newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway share prices up, Aker leads the way.
newsitem.headline: Norway share prices up, Aker leads the way.

text.p: Norwegian share prices ticked higher on Friday with offshore and construction company Aker attracting most trade on merger speculation, dealers said.
The Total share index rose 0.48 percent to 840.77 points in moderate turnover of 575 million crowns, including 58 million in Aker shares.
The index rose in late afternoon trade after the release of U.S. August consumer prices.
"It was relatively quiet until the CPI figures from the United States came in," one dealer said. "The Norwegian market firmed and Norwegian interest rates fell."
"I think on Monday there will be a positive undertone supported by the United States. It looks good," he said.

Aker climbed 4.33 percent to 132.50 crowns after a newspaper report that the company was contemplating a merger with the RGI investment group, its main shareholder. RGI, or Research Group International, rose 4.69 percent to 67 crowns.
